editionStmt.ab: This lavish seventeenth manuscript is preserved in the Dabra Warq Monastery, Goǧǧām, Ethiopia. It was microfilmed by Donald Davies between 1960–1970. Full images (balck and white) of the manuscript are now available at the HMML library, see . Stanislaw Chojnacki also photographed the miniatures of this manuscript, which are now available in the Mazgaba Śǝʿǝlāt collection (SC-014-010) of the University of Toronto, Canada. The manuscript is also catalogued by Jeremy Brown for the PEMM project, see, PEMM record.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

extent.measure: no measurment is provided by the photographer

collation.note: The quire structure with this manuscript is not discernible due to the tightness of the binding and the quality of the images.

layout.ab: Primary pricks are visible, horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: The name (and other holy names), the first two lines of the explicit of the narrations and stanzas, and all the legends of the miniatures are rubricated.

decoDesc.summary: The manuscript is richly decorated with 40 miniatures where 32 of them are painted to illustrate their corresponding miracles and the other miniatures are introductory and concluding miniatures with all belong to the so called First Gondarine style.

decoNote.desc: A miniature showing Crossing the Sea with His Staff
Miniature of Palm Sunday (the triumphal entry) of depicted mounting on a donkey
Icon of

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first who is sitting on a throne and giving the book of the to who is sitting near to him on a throne; second, providing a garment and throne ; third, 's successor who is sitting on a throne reads the and fourth, the successor bishop falling and being smitten by for having touched 's gifts to without permission.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing the peasant standing and praying near to the icon of .

A miniature illustrating with two episodes, showing: first, the Jewish priest with crossed hands praying in front of who is sitting on a throne with the two deacons in the background; second, the Jewish priest lying on the ground after his fall from excess bowing with raising the Jewish priest by her hand.

A miniature of the art theme with of two episodes, showing: first, Dǝmyānos writing the name of in a manuscript and second, Dǝmyānos lying down before the icon of Mary who is performing a gesture of blessing with a depiction of the pillar of gold painted to the top margin of the miniature.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the bishop ʾAbbās standing and distributing holy communion surrounded by the faithful, among whom is the woman who kisses his hand; second, the bishop sitting and cutting off his hand, and third, the bishop and the faithful standing in front of the icon of the , which has healed his hand.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes showing: first, the monk Yǝsḥaq falling on the ground during the apparition of Mary, and second, the icon of taking Yǝsḥaq by the hand and raising him.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: standing next to Māryām of Dafrā where the house represented with Jerusalem is depicted near to her.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the painter sitting on a scaffold and drawing a scene; second, the painter falling down from the scaffold and third, the icon of extending her hand to save the painter.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the sick pilgrim lying in bed; second the sick pilgrim riding a cloud; second, the pilgrim standing before the places to which carries him; third, Golgotha, Jerusalem, the mount of Olives, Bethlehem and the Jordan depicted in the top part of the miniature; and fourth, standing in the middle of the places depicted with a house scene background.

A miniature of the art theme with five episodes, showing: first, Zakārǝyās praying the greeting of the angel before the icon of ; second, Zakārǝyās nailing down in front of the icon of ; third, Zakārǝyās decorating Saint Mary's crown in the icon of with roses; fourth, the thieves from the jungle, lead by the head of thieves going towards Zakārǝyās who was supplicating to (who was collecting roses out of Zakārǝyās's mouth), sitting on a throne surrounded by angels and fifth, the thieves being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the two thieves whose teeth were damaged in attempting to eat the bread they stole from Yolyānā and Barbārā (standing in front of the thieves), carrying spears and second, depicts the two thieves standing before an icon of and are being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with six episodes, showing: first, the three Arabs swimming in the water; second, one man being eaten by a crocodile; third, the two pilgrims standing on a rock above the water; fourth, one man riding a camel to the monastery, which is depicted in the background; fifth, the other man bringing his sheep's wool and sixth, the camel brought by the Arab eating from a tree.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, surrounded by the sleeping monks of the monastery, which is depicted in the background; second, the monastery with its monks that has been moved to the shore of the see and third, a group of people marvelling at the miracle.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the priest Yoḥannǝs standing and praying before the icon of the Virgin and Child and second, taking out her breast and dropping her milk into the eyes of Yoḥannǝs.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the rich man from Qʷalāsis travelling with his companions on a ship; second, four individuals from Qʷǝz piercing the eye of the noble man; third, the rich man statue of the rich Grecian man standing in front of the icon of and fourth, the spears falling from the eye of the statue of the rich man.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the blind girl and her mother both standing and praying before the icon of the and second,the mother and her blind daughter both lying before the icon of ref type="authFile" corresp="AT1031VirginAndChild"/>, and third healed blind girl praying to the icon of .

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the poor widow praying before the icon of the where her three daughters are sitting below her; second, an arborist man called Tewog taking the two daughters standing next him, and third, the funeral of the eldest daughter, who is wrapped in a shroud and surrounded by persons

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the two brothers sitting and writing next to each other; second, the demons hanging the soul of one of the scribes; third, pulling down the scribe's soul from the demons; fourth, the scribe sitting again and resuming his writing with his brother.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, lying in prison bound at his hands and feet, with a dove appearing to him; second, standing healed from his wounds.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the custodian of the church standing in front of the sitting Kaṭir ordering him to leave the church; second, sitting on a throne surrounded by two with the paralysed custodian of the church sitting before her; third, the healed Kaṭir standing before , who is sitting on throne on another episode.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the weaver and the Muslim customer gathered around a piece of cloth; second, the Muslim holding the cloth of Nazib with an interest to kiss him for preparing him cloths; third, the Muslim denouncing Nazib to the judge; fourth, Nazib lying in prison bound at his hands and feet; fifth, riding on a horse, brandishing a weapon, and appearing to the judge; sixth, the judge handing to Nazib his paper of release; and seventh, Nazib entering the church, in which the people are gathered, and handing his paper of release to the priest.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes/events, showing: first, the bishop sitting on a throne before the people, who are gathered in a church, and amongst whom is the man with the petrified foot; second, the man with the petrified foot standing and praying before an icon of the while his foot is healed; third, the man showing his healed foot to the bishop with the people standing in the background.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the leper bishop Marqorewos showing his leprosy to the Patriarch Zakārǝyās; second, the depiction of the bishop Patriarch Zakārǝyās, who advised bishop Merqorewos not to deliver the holy sacrament because of his leprosy; showing him his leprosy; third, Marqorewos praying before the icon of the , and fourth, the healed bishop distributing the Eucharist.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, two men carrying the woman with a broken foot on a stretcher; second, the woman lying below the icon of the ; third, the broken foot woman again laid below the icon of on another episode; fourth, the broken woman standing before the icon of after she got healed.

A miniature of the art theme with five episodes, showing: first, Sofǝyā lying on top of a building before the icon of the and ordering an to take the child from Sofǝyā's womb ; second, an carries away the child from Sofǝyā's womb and giving it to a man named Finkǝs to adopt him; third, the bishop sitting on a throne in before a group of women accusing Sofǝyā; fourth, the bishop and Sofǝyā sitting next to each other discussing about the manner of the pregnancy; fifth, the bishop receiving the child from the hands of Finkǝs, sitting near to the bishop; and sixth, Sofǝyā's Child, who later become successor of the former bishop (died some time before), surrounded by three persons.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Bārok giving a wine in a vessel to his servant to distribute it to the guests; second, the gusts eating food in Bārok's house; third, his guests sitting and drinking wine where six pots are depicted in a row; fourth, Bārok's enemies attacking him holding several weapons; fifth, a depiction of the icon of the ; sixth, Bārok being consecrated as a monk; and seventh, the funeral of Bārok.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos standing and praying in a church where the icon of the depicted in front of him; second,ʾAnǝsṭāsyos lying before the icon of , who is extending her hand towards him and announcing him good news concerning his illness.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the monk Sālusi surrounded by other monks, who are attacking him; second, the monks preventing him to eat; third, the monk Sālusi standing and praying in a church before the icon of the and fourth, the monk Sālusi stood up near to the Church after penetrating the wall of the Church with his skull-cap fallen to the ground.

A miniature of the art theme with eight episodes, showing: first, house scenes depicted to the top margin of the miniature where the cannibal slaughtered his wife and his kids; second, the cannibal surrounded by the bodies of other individuals who killed them; third, peasants fleeing from the cannibal; fourth, the cannibal offering water to a beggar covered by sores of leprosy; fifth, , sitting on a throne ordering the demons to add the soul of the cannibal to the hell and the demons holding the soul of the cannibal; sixth; two weighing the cannibal's good and bad deeds in a scale; and seventh, holding the soul of the cannibal.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the widow's son stealing cloth from a church; second, members of the Church arresting and starting to punish the thief; third, ordering the punisher to let him free, and fourth, the thief standing in front of the icon of the who is depicted on a throne.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the woman holding her new-born child protected by from the wave; second a church amongst the waves from which the people are fleeing, and third, the woman with her child surrounded by the marvelling people.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the thirsty dog searching for water and being kicked by one of the two women sitting near to the well; second, giving the dog water to drink from her shoe and, third, the group of virgins who chase out the dog gathered around the well.
A miniature with two episodes, showing: first, Saint who is reaching her two hands praying at Golgotha over a tomb which is surrounded by keepers; and second, the apparition of Our Lord to .
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where is standing with her hands crossed on her chest, surrounded by angels on clouds.
A miniature with one episode showing providing hopes to his mother who is sitting near to the him, surrounded by angels, saints, prophets and David (playing his baganā).
A miniature showing Saint in Qarānǝyo with two episodes: first grieving about sinners and second who is standing with stretched hands praying about the sinners.
A miniature of the art theme at heaven with one episode where Our Lord and His mother Saint standing in the center of the scene and surrounded by angels.

history.provenance: The names of the original owners, ʿƎnbāqom and Gabrǝʾel, are included in the supplication formulas of the manuscript. Although erasures have been made, the names remain readable in several places

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.
